item.title: Suggestions for a laptop mic for lectures
item.dc:creator: taxi_evil
item.description:
My advice is spend the money on a good pen and a notebook, and take notes the old fashioned way

Seriously, I know people that have tried dictaphones and all sorts, but you learn a lot more through the act of actually writing it. I take rough notes in lectures, then write them up later in my own words. This gives me something to revise from, and picks up anything I don’t understand

item.title: Suggestions for a laptop mic for lectures
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
not that stupid, depends on a few things, how close will you be, whats your price range, and does it need to be direct to your pc?

If your are close enough and have a little extra cash I would recommend something like the Blue snowflake $50~$60. I haven’t used it personally but I have use the blue snow ball and was VERY impressed with the company.

In almost in every case you will get much better quality over USB but if you want something cheaper you can still get usable material over the mic port.
